alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Craven; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 11:13AM EDT until September 23 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... Northwestern Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1113 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Greenville. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville, Washington, Winterville, Ayden, Bethel, Grifton, Stokes, Bell Arthur, Pactolus, Shelmerdine, House, Calico, Black Jack, Fort Barnwell, Bruce, Roundtree, Wilmar, Old Ford, Dowdy Ficklen Stadium and East Carolina University. Evans St at Greenway, 14th St at the bridge, First St from Elm to Oak, and numerous other roads are closed. closed or will soon be closed in Greenville, NC. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
